questions.question: In a graph data structure, what term is used for the numerical value representing the cost, distance, or time associated with a connection between two nodes?
questions.answer: Weight

questions.question: In the notes, artificial neural networks can be drawn as graphs where
options: Each neuron is an edge and each connection is a node
Each neuron is a node and each connection is an edge
Each neuron is a path and each connection is a graph
Each neuron is a weight and each connection is a node
questions.answer: Each neuron is a node and each connection is an edge

questions.question: According to the notes, Dijkstra’s algorithm is used to find
options: The largest cluster in unlabelled data
The shortest path between two nodes in a weighted graph
A polynomial curve from data points
questions.answer: The shortest path between two nodes in a weighted graph

questions.question: According to the notes, the first distance assignment step in Dijkstra’s algorithm sets
options: All nodes to infinity, except the start node to 0
questions.answer: All nodes to infinity, except the start node to 0

questions.question: In A*, which option correctly states both the formula and the meaning of h(n) as described in the notes?
options: f(n) = g(n) + h(n), and h(n) is a heuristic estimate of the cost from the current node to the goal
f(n) = g(n) − h(n), and h(n) is the cost from the start node to the current node
f(n) = h(n) − g(n), and h(n) is the cost from the start node to the current node
f(n) = g(n) + h(n), and h(n) is the cost from the start node to the current node
questions.answer: f(n) = g(n) + h(n), and h(n) is a heuristic estimate of the cost from the current node to the goal

questions.question: Match each term (1 to 4) with its description (A to D). 1. Node (Vertex) 2. Edge 3. Weights 4. Path A. Numerical values representing cost, distance, or time on a connection B. Sequence of edges connecting two nodes C. Entity such as a location, object, or point in a network D. Connection or relationship between two nodes

pairs.Node (Vertex): Entity such as a location, object, or point in a network
pairs.Edge: Connection or relationship between two nodes
pairs.Weights: Numerical values representing cost, distance, or time on a connection
pairs.Path: Sequence of edges connecting two nodes

questions.question: Match each AI graph application (1 to 3) with its description (A to C). 1. Pathfinding and Navigation 2. Network Routing 3. Knowledge Representation A. Optimizing data transfer in communication networks B. Finding the shortest or optimal route in GPS systems C. Representing relationships between concepts, such as in semantic networks

pairs.Pathfinding and Navigation: Finding the shortest or optimal route in GPS systems
pairs.Network Routing: Optimizing data transfer in communication networks
pairs.Knowledge Representation: Representing relationships between concepts, such as in semantic networks

questions.question: In the notes, the input layer primarily
options: Extracts abstract features from previous layers
Receives raw data, such as images, text, or numerical values
Produces the final classification or prediction
Computes heuristic estimates to the goal
questions.answer: Receives raw data, such as images, text, or numerical values

questions.question: In the notes, a bias is described as
options: An extra adjustable value added to help the neuron produce the right output
A cost from start to current node
A list of nodes marked finalized
questions.answer: An extra adjustable value added to help the neuron produce the right output

questions.question: In the notes, an activation function is described as
options: A rule that converts the combined value into the neuron’s output signal
A rule that assigns infinity to all nodes
A clustering method for unlabelled data
A polynomial equation using squared terms
questions.answer: A rule that converts the combined value into the neuron’s output signal

questions.question: In the notes, if an input is not numerical, it must be
options: Converted to a numerical value so weighted values can be summed
Placed in the output layer directly
Turned into a heuristic value h(n)
questions.answer: Converted to a numerical value so weighted values can be summed

questions.question: In the notes, training of an ANN involves
options: Adjusting weights based on error feedback during training
questions.answer: Adjusting weights based on error feedback during training

questions.question: Match each ANN layer (1 to 3) with its role (A to C). 1. Input layer 2. Hidden layers 3. Output layer A. Produces the final classification or prediction B. Receives raw data C. Extracts features and patterns

pairs.Output layer: Produces the final classification or prediction

questions.question: In the notes, machine learning enables systems to learn from data and improve performance without
questions.answer: Explicit programming

questions.question: In the notes, unsupervised learning groups data into
questions.answer: Clusters

questions.question: In the notes, reinforcement learning is guided by
questions.answer: Rewards and penalties

questions.question: In the notes, deep learning is
options: A different name for unsupervised learning
A subset of machine learning using ANNs with multiple layers
Only a statistical technique for prediction
questions.answer: A subset of machine learning using ANNs with multiple layers

questions.question: In the notes, in a deep learning network, each connection between two neurons has a weight that controls
options: How strongly the signal from one neuron affects the next neuron
questions.answer: How strongly the signal from one neuron affects the next neuron

questions.question: Match each learning type (1 to 3) with its defining description (A to C). 1. Supervised learning 2. Unsupervised learning 3. Reinforcement learning A. Learns by interacting with an environment using rewards and penalties B. Uses labelled data with known outputs C. Finds patterns in unlabelled data and forms clusters or associations

pairs.Supervised learning: Uses labelled data with known outputs
pairs.Unsupervised learning: Finds patterns in unlabelled data and forms clusters or associations
pairs.Reinforcement learning: Learns by interacting with an environment using rewards and penalties

questions.question: Match each term (1 to 2) with the output description in the notes (A to B). 1. Classification 2. Regression A. Output is a category B. Output is a number
In the notes, backpropagation is an optimization technique used in training ANNs to
options: Increase the number of layers permanently
Minimize errors by adjusting weights of connections based on feedback from the output layer
Replace labelled data with unlabelled data
questions.answer: Minimize errors by adjusting weights of connections based on feedback from the output layer

questions.question: In the notes, the adjustment method that changes weights step by step in the direction that makes the error smaller is called
questions.answer: Gradient descent

questions.question: Match each backpropagation step (1 to 4) with its description (A to D). 1. Forward pass 2. Error calculation 3. Backward pass 4. Repeat A. Compute difference between predicted and actual outputs B. Continue the process until the error is minimized C. Process input data to make predictions D. Send error backward and adjust weights using gradient descent

pairs.Forward pass: Process input data to make predictions
pairs.Error calculation: Compute difference between predicted and actual outputs
pairs.Backward pass: Send error backward and adjust weights using gradient descent
pairs.Repeat: Continue the process until the error is minimized

questions.question: In the notes, regression is described as a technique used to
options: Model relationships between variables and make continuous predictions
Find shortest paths in weighted graphs
questions.answer: Model relationships between variables and make continuous predictions

questions.question: In the notes, the output value in regression (example: house price) is called the
questions.answer: Dependent variable

questions.question: In the notes, linear regression models
options: A curved relationship using squared terms
A straight line relationship between variables
questions.answer: A straight line relationship between variables

questions.question: Match each regression type (1 to 2) with its description (A to B). 1. Linear regression 2. Polynomial regression A. Straight line relationship B. Curved (non linear) relationship using polynomial terms such as x²

pairs.Polynomial regression: Curved (non linear) relationship using polynomial terms such as x²
